description: motor +‎ cycle, from the Motorcyclette produced in 1897 by the French Werner Frères et Cie.

entries.meaning: An open-seated motor vehicle with handlebars instead of a steering wheel, and having two (or sometimes three) wheels.

verbs.description: motorcycle (third-person singular simple present motorcycles, present participle motorcycling, simple past and past participle motorcycled)
